meanings.definition: A statement that someone has done something wrong or illegal, typically without proof.
meanings.sent1: The teacher made an allegation that the student cheated on the test.
meanings.sent2: The police are investigating the allegation of theft at the store.
meanings.sent3: The allegation that the dog ate the homework was quite amusing to the students.
meanings.sent4: Her allegation that the sun was a giant flashlight was metaphorical and amusing.
meanings.sent5: The allegation that aliens built the pyramids was so vivid and unbelievable.

meanings.definition: The act of asserting something without proof.
meanings.sent1: His allegation of seeing a ghost in the attic scared his friends.
meanings.sent2: The politician's allegation of corruption caused a stir in the community.
meanings.sent3: The allegation that the moon was made of cheese was quite amusing to the children.
meanings.sent4: Her allegation that time was a river flowing backward was striking and thought-provoking.
meanings.sent5: The allegation that the tree could talk was so vivid and imaginative.
